is the system just not booting it, not finding the parition or what
Yeah but did you install only to the partition you made for it or did you select guided use entire disk?
Im guessing you installed over your windows partition
in that case, your lucky that windows is so bloated, you may be able to recover some of your files
You should have backed the data up on your shiny new drive before you went ahead with the install
I suggest getting a recovery disk somewhere very soon
And do not install anything else until you get your files recovered as much as you can
recovery disk ?
It is a great OS, I finally got rid of my dual boot system, and soley use ubuntu now

Yah you should look into some programs that can do recovery.. your files may not be erased, but the 'pointers' to them are missing.Recovery software digs beyond the pointers and extracts the raw files and lets you recover them
get a program called gmount-iso
You can do it from command line, but gmount is also a good program to use from graphical interface
